intro: Hibbertia empetrifolia subsp. uncinata, commonly known as the hooked hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and distinctive yellow flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its hooked bracts and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in heathland and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
